title: Was Trump's travel ban targeted at Muslims? A federal appeals court zeroes in on the debate
text: "The panel seemed clearly to want to avoid a legal standard under which the Japanese internment camps would be constitutional, and that's good news for Hawaii and the plaintiffs," said Schlanger, who worked on civil rights in the Department of Homeland Security under the Obama administration.
summary: "The panel seemed clearly to want to avoid a legal standard under which the Japanese internment camps would be constitutional, and that's good news for Hawaii and the plaintiffs," said Schlanger, who worked on civil rights in the Department of Homeland Security under the Obama administration.
